div.p: Understorey palm. Stems clustered, to 10 m tall and 8 cm in diameter. Leaf blade 120-220 cm long; pinnae 50-65 on each side, narrowly wedge shaped, inserted in groups of 4-14 and spreading in different planes, the central ones 20-45 cm long and 5-10 cm wide, often abrubtly widening and irregularly toothed at apex. Inflorescence 0.7-1.5 m long, with 35-75 branches. Flowers yellow. Fruits ca. 2 cm in diameter, bright red.
Endemic to the dry forest zone in W Ecuador and adjacent NW Peru.
Vulnerable (Borchsenius & Skov 1999). Criteria A1c, B1, B2c
Closely related to Aiphanes aculeata, but different in its more numerous, narrower pinnae, and clustered habit.
